title: Protecting America's Bank Account Against Fraud, Waste, and Abuse

enrichment.summary: This executive order strengthens the federal governmentâ€™s ability to prevent financial fraud and improper payments by requiring agencies to provide detailed payment information to the Department of the Treasury. It promotes transparency, accountability, and efficiency by consolidating payment authority and financial systems under the Treasury to better track, verify, and manage federal funds.
potential_concerns: Consolidation of payment systems under the Treasury may reduce agency flexibility and create operational bottlenecks.
Increased data sharing and centralization could raise privacy and security risks, especially related to sensitive taxpayer and payment information.
Smaller agencies or Non-Treasury Disbursing Offices may face challenges adapting to new reporting and system integration requirements.
Aggressive pre-certification verification processes might delay legitimate payments or impose administrative burdens on agencies and payees.
Ensuring compliance across diverse federal agencies and resolving exemptions could complicate effective implementation.
